TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SignedXml extends System.Object

summary.span: Provides a wrapper on a core XML signature object to facilitate creating XML signatures.

span.span: Provides a wrapper on a core XML signature object to facilitate creating XML signatures.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 類別是.NET Framework 實作的 World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) [XML 簽章語法和處理規格](https://www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/)，也稱為 XMLDSIG （XML 數位簽章）。The class is the .NET Framework implementation of the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) [XML Signature Syntax and Processing Specification](https://www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/), also known as XMLDSIG (XML Digital Signature). XMLDSIG 是標準為基礎、 可互通的方式來簽署與驗證全部或部分 XML 文件或其他可定址的統一資源識別元 (URI) 的資料。XMLDSIG is a standards-based, interoperable way to sign and verify all or part of an XML document or other data that is addressable from a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI). 使用類別，每當您需要共用以標準方式簽署應用程式或組織之間的 XML 資料。Use the class whenever you need to share signed XML data between applications or organizations in a standard way. 使用這個類別簽章的任何資料可驗證的 XMLDSIG 的 W3C 規格的任何合格的實作。Any data signed using this class can be verified by any conforming implementation of the W3C specification for XMLDSIG. 類別可讓您建立 XML 數位簽章的下列三種：The class allows you to create the following three kinds of XML digital signatures: |簽章類型Signature Type|描述Description| |--------------------|-----------------| |包裹簽章Enveloped signature|簽章會包含在要簽署的 XML 項目。The signature is contained within the XML element being signed.| |您可以在封裝的簽章Enveloping signature|帶正負號的 XML 包含在 <`Signature`> 項目。The signed XML is contained within the <`Signature`> element.| |內部的中斷簽章Internal detached signature|簽章和已簽署的 XML 在相同的文件，但沒有項目包含其他。The signature and signed XML are in the same document, but neither element contains the other.| 另外還有第四種呼叫也就是個別的 XML 文件中的資料和簽章時外部中斷簽章的簽章。There is also a fourth kind of signature called an external detached signature which is when the data and signature are in separate XML documents. 不支援外部卸離的簽章類別。External detached signatures are not supported by the class. ## 結構的 XML 簽章The structure of an XML Signature XMLDSIG 會建立 <`Signature`> 元素，其中包含 XML 文件或其他資料，便可從 URI 來定址的數位簽章。XMLDSIG creates a <`Signature`> element, which contains a digital signature of an XML document or other data that is addressable from a URI. <`Signature`> 元素可以選擇性地包含有關在哪裡尋找將會驗證簽章金鑰和密碼編譯演算法用於簽章。The <`Signature`> element can optionally contain information about where to find a key that will verify the signature and which cryptographic algorithm was used for signing. 基本結構如下所示：The basic structure is as follows: ```xml Base64EncodedValue== AnotherBase64EncodedValue=== ``` 此結構的主要部分如下：The main parts of this structure are: <`CanonicalizationMethod`> 項目The <`CanonicalizationMethod`> element 指定的重寫規則`Signature`從 XML/文字的項目，在簽章驗證的位元組。Specifies the rules for rewriting the `Signature` element from XML/text into bytes for signature validation. .NET Framework 中的預設值是http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xml-c14n-20010315，以識別可信任的演算法。The default value in the .NET Framework is http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xml-c14n-20010315, which identifies a trustworthy algorithm. 這個項目由屬性。This element is represented by the property. <`SignatureMethod`> 項目The <`SignatureMethod`> element 指定用於簽章產生和驗證，並已套用至演算法 <`Signature`> 元素中的值會產生 <`SignatureValue`>。Specifies the algorithm used for signature generation and validation, which was applied to the <`Signature`> element to produce the value in <`SignatureValue`>. 在範例中，值http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#rsa-sha1識別之 RSA PKCS1 sha-1 簽章。In the example above, the value http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#rsa-sha1 identifies an RSA PKCS1 SHA-1 signature. 這個項目由屬性。This element is represented by the property. <`SignatureValue`> 項目The <`SignatureValue`> element 指定的密碼編譯簽章 <`Signature`> 項目。Specifies the cryptographic signature for the <`Signature`> element. 如果此簽章不會驗證，然後的某些部分 <`Signature`> 區塊已遭竄改，和文件會被視為無效。If this signature does not verify, then some portion of the <`Signature`> block was tampered with, and the document is considered invalid. 只要 <`CanonicalizationMethod`> 值是可信任，這個值是能抵抗竄改。As long as the <`CanonicalizationMethod`> value is trustworthy, this value is highly resistant to tampering. 這個項目由屬性。This element is represented by the property. `URI`屬性的 <`Reference`> 項目The `URI` attribute of the <`Reference`> element 指定資料物件，使用 URI 參考。Specifies a data object using a URI reference. 這個屬性由屬性。This attribute is represented by the property. - 未指定`URI`屬性，也就是設定屬性設`null`，表示接收應用程式，應該知道的物件識別。Not specifying the `URI` attribute, that is, setting the property to `null`, means that the receiving application is expected to know the identity of the object. 在大部分情況下， `null` URI 會導致擲回例外狀況。In most cases, a `null` URI will result in an exception being thrown. 請勿使用`null`URI，除非您的應用程式與通訊協定，需要它交互操作。Do not use a `null` URI, unless your application is interoperating with a protocol which requires it. - 設定`URI`屬性設為空字串表示，要簽署文件的根項目，一種已包裹簽章。Setting the `URI` attribute to an empty string indicates that the root element of the document is being signed, a form of enveloped signature. - 如果值`URI`屬性開頭為 #，則值必須解析為目前的文件中的項目。If the value of `URI` attribute starts with #, then the value must resolve to an element in the current document. 此表單後可以搭配任何支援的簽章類型 （包裹簽章，包裹簽章或內部的中斷簽章）。This form can be used with any of the supported signature types (enveloped signature, enveloping signature or internal detached signature). - 任何其他項目會被視為外部資源中斷簽章，並不支援類別。Anything else is considered an external resource detached signature and is not supported by the class. <`Transforms`> 項目The <`Transforms`> element 包含已排序的清單的 <`Transform`> 描述如何簽署者取得的資料物件的項目一。Contains an ordered list of <`Transform`> elements that describe how the signer obtained the data object that was digested. 轉換演算法是類似的規範化方法，但而不是重寫 <`Signature`> 項目，便會重新寫入所識別的內容`URI`屬性 <`Reference`> 項目。A transform algorithm is similar to the canonicalization method, but instead of rewriting the <`Signature`> element, it rewrites the content identified by the `URI` attribute of the <`Reference`> element. <`Transforms`> 項目由類別。The <`Transforms`> element is represented by the class. - 每個轉換演算法被定義為 XML (XPath 節點集) 或位元組做為輸入。Each transform algorithm is defined as taking either XML (an XPath node-set) or bytes as input. 如果目前的資料格式和轉換的輸入需求不同，則會套用轉換規則。If the format of the current data differs from the transform input requirements, conversion rules are applied. - 每個轉換演算法會定義為做為輸出中產生 XML 或位元組。Each transform algorithm is defined as producing either XML or bytes as the output. - 如果最後一個轉換演算法的輸出不會定義以位元組為單位 （或任何轉換所指定），然後的規範化方法http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xml-c14n-20010315做為隱含的轉換 (即使在 指定不同的演算法 <`CanonicalizationMethod`>項目）。If the output of the last transform algorithm is not defined in bytes (or no transforms were specified), then the canonicalization method http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xml-c14n-20010315 is used as an implicit transform (even if a different algorithm was specified in the <`CanonicalizationMethod`> element). - 值為http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#enveloped-signature演算法會解譯為移除的規則編碼轉換 <`Signature`> 文件中的項目。A value of http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#enveloped-signature for the transform algorithm encodes a rule which is interpreted as remove the <`Signature`> element from the document. 否則，包裹簽章的驗證器將會摘要文件，包括簽章，但簽署人會有一文件之前套用簽章，導致不同的答案。Otherwise, a verifier of an enveloped signature will digest the document, including the signature, but the signer would have digested the document before the signature was applied, leading to different answers. <`DigestMethod`> 項目The <`DigestMethod`> element 識別要套用在轉換後的內容所識別的摘要 （密碼編譯雜湊） 方法`URI`屬性的 <`Reference`> 項目。Identifies the digest (cryptographic hash) method to apply on the transformed content identified by the `URI` attribute of the <`Reference`> element. 這由屬性。This is represented by the property. ## 選擇的規範化方法Choosing a canonicalization method 除非間的互通性規格，而這需要使用不同的值，我們建議您在.NET Framework 中這是 XML C14N 1.0 演算法，其值是使用預設的規範化方法http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xml-c14n-20010315。Unless interoperating with a specification which requires the use of a different value, we recommend that you use the default canonicalization method in the .NET Framework which is the XML-C14N 1.0 algorithm, whose value is http://www.w3.org/TR/2001/REC-xml-c14n-20010315. 特別是當它是最終的隱含轉換，以套用時，XML C14N 1.0 演算法才 XMLDSIG 的所有實作必須支援。The XML-C14N 1.0 algorithm is required to be supported by all implementations of XMLDSIG, particularly as it is an implicit final transform to apply. 有規範化演算法，以支援保留的註解的版本。There are versions of canonicalization algorithms which support preserving comments. 不建議註解保留的規範化方法，因為它們違反 「 所見登入 」 原則。Comment-preserving canonicalization methods are not recommended because they violate the "sign what is seen" principle. 也就是中的註解 <`Signature`> 項目並不會更改處理邏輯的簽章的執行方式，只是簽章值。That is, the comments in a <`Signature`> element will not alter the processing logic for how the signature is performed, merely what the signature value is. 使用弱式的簽章演算法時，允許的註解是包含可讓攻擊者不必要的 「 彈性地強制雜湊衝突，結合時進行竄改的文件，看起來像是合法。When combined with a weak signature algorithm, allowing the comments to be included gives an attacker unnecessary freedom to force a hash collision, making a tampered document appear legitimate. 在.NET Framework 中，只有內建 canonicalizers 支援預設。In the .NET Framework, only built-in canonicalizers are supported by default. 若要支援其他或自訂 canonicalizers，請參閱屬性。To support additional or custom canonicalizers, see the property. 如果文件會使用不在所表示之集合的規範化方法屬性，則方法會傳回`false`。If the document uses a canonicalization method that is not in the collection represented by the property, then the method will return `false`. > [!NOTE] > 極防禦性的應用程式可以移除不會預期要從使用簽署的任何值集合。An extremely defensive application can remove any values it does not expect signers to use from the collection. ## 會參考值遭到竄改的安全？Are the Reference values safe from tampering? 是，<`Reference`> 值會遭到竄改的安全。Yes, the <`Reference`> values are safe from tampering. .NET framework 會確認 <`SignatureValue`> 再處理任何計算 <`Reference`> 值和其相關聯轉換，和將會提早中止以避免潛在的惡意的處理指示。The .NET framework verifies the <`SignatureValue`> computation before processing any of the <`Reference`> values and their associated transforms, and will abort early to avoid potentially malicious processing instructions. ## 選擇要簽署項目Choosing the elements to sign 我們建議您改用的值""的`URI`屬性 (或設定屬性設為空字串)，如果可能的話。We recommend that you use the value of "" for the `URI` attribute (or set the property to an empty string), if possible. 這表示整個文件會被視為摘要計算，這表示整個文件保護以免遭到竄改。This means the whole document is considered for the digest computation, which means the whole document is protected from tampering. 它是常見到機房`URI`錨點，例如 #foo，指的其 ID 屬性為"foo"的項目表單中的值。It is very common to see `URI` values in the form of anchors such as #foo, referring to an element whose ID attribute is "foo". 不幸的是，很容易遭到竄改，因為這樣會包含目標項目，而不是內容的內容。Unfortunately, it is easy for this to be tampered with because this includes only the content of the target element, not the context. 濫用這項區別即為 XML 簽章包裝 (XSW)。Abusing this distinction is known as XML Signature Wrapping (XSW). 如果您的應用程式會認為是語意的註解 （這不是常見的時，處理 XML），則您應該使用 「 #xpointer(/)"而不是""，和 「 #xpointer(id('foo'))"而不是 「 #foo"。If your application considers comments to be semantic (which is not common when dealing with XML), then you should use "#xpointer(/)" instead of "", and "#xpointer(id('foo'))" instead of "#foo". #Xpointer 版本都會解譯為包括註解，雖然簡短名稱表單會排除註解。The #xpointer versions are interpreted as including comments, while the shortname forms are excluding comments. 如果您需要接受僅部分受保護的文件，而且您想要確保您正在閱讀的相同的內容保護簽章，請使用方法。If you need to accept documents which are only partially protected and you want to ensure that you are reading the same content that the signature protected, use the method. ## KeyInfo 項目相關的安全性考量Security considerations about the KeyInfo element 在選擇性資料 <`KeyInfo`> 項目 (也就是屬性)，其中包含驗證簽章，金鑰不應該信任。The data in the optional <`KeyInfo`> element (that is, the property), which contains a key to validate the signature, should not be trusted. 特別是當值代表裸機 RSA、 DSA 或 ECDSA 公開金鑰，文件可能已遭竄改，儘管reporting 簽章是否有效的方法。In particular, when the value represents a bare RSA, DSA or ECDSA public key, the document could have been tampered with, despite the method reporting that the signature is valid. 這可能是因為進行的竄改只實體，就必須產生新的金鑰，並使用該新的金鑰重新簽署遭竄改的文件。This can happen because the entity doing the tampering just has to generate a new key and re-sign the tampered document with that new key. 因此，除非您的應用程式驗證的公開金鑰是預期的值，在文件應該視為已遭他人修改。So, unless your application verifies that the public key is an expected value, the document should be treated as if it were tampered with. 這需要您的應用程式檢查內嵌在文件的公開金鑰，並確認它根據已知值的文件內容的清單。This requires that your application examine the public key embedded within the document and verify it against a list of known values for the document context. 比方說，如果文件無法瞭解發行的已知的使用者，您會檢查對該使用者所使用的已知索引鍵的清單金鑰。For example, if the document could be understood to be issued by a known user, you'd check the key against a list of known keys used by that user. 您也可以在使用中處理文件之後，驗證金鑰方法，而不是使用方法。You can also verify the key after processing the document by using the method, instead of using the method. 不過，為了取得最佳的安全性，您應該事先驗證金鑰。But, for the optimal security, you should verify the key beforehand. 或者，請考慮嘗試使用者的已註冊的公開金鑰，而不是讀取功能的 <`KeyInfo`> 項目。Alternately, consider trying the user's registered public keys, rather than reading what's in the <`KeyInfo`> element. ## X509Data 項目相關的安全性考量Security considerations about the X509Data element 選擇性的 <`X509Data`> 元素是子系 <`KeyInfo`> 項目和包含一或多個的 X509 憑證或識別項的 X509 憑證。The optional <`X509Data`> element is a child of the <`KeyInfo`> element and contains one or more X509 certificates or identifiers for X509 certificates. 中的資料 <`X509Data`> 項目也不應該本質上受到信任。The data in the <`X509Data`> element should also not be inherently trusted. 驗證含有內嵌的文件時 <`X509Data`> 項目，.NET Framework 會確認只有資料解析為 X509 憑證的公開金鑰可以成功地用來驗證文件簽章。When verifying a document with the embedded <`X509Data`> element, the .NET Framework verifies only that the data resolves to an X509 certificate whose public key can be successfully used to validate the document signature. 不同於呼叫方法`verifySignatureOnly`參數設為`false`、 無撤銷檢查會執行、 檢查沒有鏈結信任時，和會驗證沒有到期日。Unlike calling the method with the `verifySignatureOnly` parameter set to `false`, no revocation check is performed, no chain trust is checked, and no expiration is verified. 即使您的應用程式會擷取憑證本身，並將它傳遞給方法`verifySignatureOnly`參數設為`false`，也就是仍不足夠的驗證，以避免資料遭到竄改的文件。Even if your application extracts the certificate itself and passes it to the method with the `verifySignatureOnly` parameter set to `false`, that is still not sufficient validation to prevent document tampering. 憑證仍必須為適用於簽署的文件進行驗證。The certificate still needs to be verified as being appropriate for the document being signed. 使用內嵌的簽署憑證可提供有用的金鑰輪替策略是否在 <`X509Data`> 區段或文件內容中。Using an embedded signing certificate can provide useful key rotation strategies, whether in the <`X509Data`> section or in the document content. 使用此方式時應用程式應該以手動方式擷取憑證，並執行驗證類似於：When using this approach an application should extract the certificate manually and perform validation similar to: - 憑證已發出直接或透過鏈結的憑證授權單位 (CA) 的公開憑證內嵌在應用程式。The certificate was issued directly or via a chain by a Certificate Authority (CA) whose public certificate is embedded in the application. 使用作業系統提供的信任清單，而不需額外的檢查，例如已知的主體名稱，並不足以防止竄改。Using the OS-provided trust list without additional checks, such as a known subject name, is not sufficient to prevent tampering in . - 憑證會驗證為已過期的文件簽署時 （或 「 現在 」 的近乎即時的文件處理）。The certificate is verified to have not been expired at the time of document signing (or "now" for near real-time document processing). - 對於長時間執行可支援撤銷 CA 所簽發的憑證，請確認憑證未被撤銷。For long-lived certificates issued by a CA which supports revocation, verify the certificate was not revoked. - 憑證主體會為目前的文件的適當驗證。The certificate subject is verified as being appropriate to the current document. ## 選擇轉換演算法Choosing the transform algorithm 如果您在具有取決於特定的值 （例如 XrML) 規格與交互操作，您需要遵循此規格。If you are interoperating with a specification which has dictated specific values (such as XrML), then you need to follow the specification. 如果您有包裹簽章 (例如當簽署整份文件)，您需要使用那麼http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#enveloped-signature(由類別)。If you have an enveloped signature (such as when signing the whole document), then you need to use http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#enveloped-signature (represented by the class). 您可以指定隱含 XML C14N 轉換，但您不需要。You can specify the implicit XML-C14N transform as well, but it's not necessary. 信封或已卸離的簽章，不不需要任何轉換。For an enveloping or detached signature, no transforms are required. 隱含的 XML C14N 轉換會負責所有項目。The implicit XML-C14N transform takes care of everything. 安全性更新所引進[Microsoft 安全性公告 MS16 035](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/security/ms16-035.aspx)，.NET Framework 有受限制的轉換可以是用於驗證文件依預設，不受信任的轉換導致一律傳回`false`。With the security updated introduced by the [Microsoft Security Bulletin MS16-035](https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/security/ms16-035.aspx), the .NET Framework has restricted what transforms can be used in document verification by default, with untrusted transforms causing to always return `false`. 特別的是，這需要額外的輸入 （指定為 XML 中的子元素） 的轉換不再允許因為其造成的濫用的機率惡意使用者。In particular, transforms which require additional input (specified as child elements in the XML) are no longer allowed due to their susceptibility of abuse by malicious users. W3C 建議避免使用 XPath 和 XSLT 轉換，也就是受到這些限制的兩個主要的轉換。The W3C advises avoiding the XPath and XSLT transforms, which are the two main transforms affected by these restrictions. ## 外部參考問題The problem with external references 如果應用程式不會驗證外部參考似乎適用於目前的內容，他們可能會遭到濫用以提供許多安全性弱點 （包括阻斷服務，分散式反映阻斷服務，資訊的方式洩漏、 簽章略過和遠端執行程式碼）。If an application does not verify that external references seem appropriate for the current context, they can be abused in ways that provide for many security vulnerabilities (including Denial of Service, Distributed Reflection Denial of Service, Information Disclosure, Signature Bypass, and Remote Code Execution). 即使應用程式來驗證外部參考的 URI，會保留兩次載入資源的問題： 只要您的應用程式時讀取它，而且一旦時讀取它。Even if an application were to validate the external reference URI, there would remain a problem of the resource being loaded twice: once when your application reads it, and once when reads it. 因為不保證的應用程式讀取和文件驗證步驟具有相同的內容時，簽章不提供可信度。Since there’s no guarantee that the application read and document verify steps have the same content, the signature does not provide trustworthiness. 指定的外部參考，風險遇到外部參考時便會擲回例外狀況。Given the risks of external references, will throw an exception when an external reference is encountered. 如需有關此問題的詳細資訊，請參閱 < [ 知識庫文章 3148821](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/3148821)。For more information about this issue, see [KB article 3148821](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/3148821). ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範如何登入，並確認整個 XML 文件使用包裹簽章。The following code example shows how to sign and verify an entire XML document using an enveloped signature. remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法也會計算參考的摘要和簽章值。This method also computes the digest of the references and the value of the signature. 如果 X.509 簽章簽署 XML 文件方法會搜尋適用的驗證憑證的 「 通訊錄 」 存放區。If an XML document was signed with an X.509 signature, the method will search the "AddressBook" store for certificates suitable for the verification. 例如，如果憑證參考的主體金鑰識別項 (SKI)，方法會選取與此 SKI 的憑證，並嘗試一個接著一個直到它可以驗證憑證。For example, if the certificate is referenced by a Subject Key Identifier (SKI), the method will select certificates with this SKI and try them one after another until it can verify the certificate. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範如何登入，並確認整個 XML 文件使用包裹簽章。The following code example shows how to sign and verify an entire XML document using an enveloped signature. remarks.format: ## Remarks 類別會解析外部 XML 資源，名為的統一資源識別元 (URI)。The class resolves external XML resources named by a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI). 如果您不信任的來源 XML 檔案，您可能不想允許 XML 檔，以存取由 URI 命名的電腦資源。If you do not trust the source of the XML file, you might not want to allow the XML file to access computer resources named by the URI. 您可以使用屬性，來控制電腦資源已藉由指定不同的 XML 檔案的存取層級物件。You can use the property to control the level of access that XML files have to computer resources by specifying different objects. 如果您不想允許任何存取權，您可以設定此屬性`null`(`Nothing` Visual Basic 中)。If you do not want to allow any access, you can set this property to `null` (`Nothing` in Visual Basic).

span.span: if the format is acceptable; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 這個方法可用來確保，會使用特定的轉換，或簽章會使用特定的雜湊演算法和等等。This method can be used to ensure that only certain transforms are used, or that the signature uses a certain hash algorithm, and so on. 將屬性設定為`null`會移除所有簽章格式驗證從物件。Setting the property to `null` removes all signature format validation from the object. 您也可以讀取物件的目前的委派和鏈結，如果您想要。You can also read the object's current delegate and chain to it if you want. 如果您要設定格式驗證程式，做為輸入參數，將會收到您提供的委派物件正在驗證，並傳回布林值 –`true`的格式是可接受的如果`false`如果不是。If you are setting up a format validator, the delegate you supply will receive as an input parameter the object being verified and returns a Boolean value – `true` if the format is acceptable, `false` if it is not. 如果委派傳回`false`因為任何原因而物件會報告 XML 簽章無效。If the delegate returns `false` for any reason, the object will report that the XML signature is not valid.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 屬性表示 <`SignatureMethod`> XML 數位簽章使用之屬性內所包含的統一資源識別元 (URI) 字串的項目。The property represents the <`SignatureMethod`> element of an XML digital signature using a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) string contained within the property. <`SignatureMethod`> 元素為的子元素 <`SignedInfo`> 項目。The <`SignatureMethod`> element is a subelement of the <`SignedInfo`> element. 使用屬性來擷取 <`SignatureMethod`> 所使用的 URI物件。Use the property to retrieve the <`SignatureMethod`> URI used by the object. 這是一個唯讀的屬性。This property is read only. 如需有關以程式設計方式指定的 URI <`SignatureMethod`> 項目，請參閱屬性。For more information about programmatically specifying a URI for the <`SignatureMethod`> element, see the property. 如需詳細資訊``項目，請參閱 XMLDSIG 規格，可在 www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/。For more information about the `` element, see the XMLDSIG specification, which is available at www.w3.org/TR/xmldsig-core/.
